Detailed Description

The purpose of this class is to register ProBT objects in order to save them to file archives and later restoring them.

Warning: the file format compatibility is only guaranteed with versions of ProBT sharing the same major and minor numbers than the version used to save the archive.

See Also
plVersion::get_version()

void plSerializer::add_object ( const std::string &  name_obj,
const T &  obj 
)

Register an object.

If another object was previously registered with the same name, the new one will replace it without any warning.

bool plSerializer::object_exists ( const std::string &  name_obj) const

Returns true is object with name name_obj already exists.

Returns false otherwise.

bool plSerializer::remove_object ( const std::string &  name_obj)

Unregister an object.

If no object has been previously registered under this name, the function returns false. It returns true otherwise.

static void plSerializer::set_strict_mode ( bool  m)
inlinestatic

Choose if the serializer class should operate in strict mode.

Strict mode means that ProBT will refuse to load a serialization archive if either the ProBT version, the BOOST version or the compiler of the archive creator was different from those of the running ProBT.

The default is false, which means that ProBT will attempt to load any archive, possibly leading to a crash.
